title: Spheres connected by wire in equilibrium

content.prompt: A metal sphere with radius r1 has a total electric charge of magnitude q. An uncharged metal sphere with radius r2 (with r1 > r2) is then connected by a wire to the first sphere, as illustrated above. The separation of the spheres is much greater than the radius of either sphere. When equilibrium is reached, the spheres will have

choices.label: charges on their surfaces of equal magnitude and the same sign
charges on their surfaces of equal magnitude and opposite sign

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
